english: rare character used as a phonetic

etymology.interpretation: Built from the pig component 豕 to suggest a semantic domain, with 乂 supplying the yì sound. It survives mostly as a phonetic element in other characters (e.g., 毅), preserving the pronunciation rather than an independent meaning.

parts.english: to regulate; to govern; to cut

examples.chinese: 这个字豙很少见(這個字豙很少見)。
examples.english: The character 豙 is rarely seen.

examples.chinese: 在“毅”字里，豙作声旁(在「毅」字裡，豙作聲旁)。
examples.pinyin: Zài “Yì” zì lǐ, Yì zuò shēngpáng.
examples.english: In the character “毅,” 豙 serves as the phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 学古文字时，我们会遇到豙(學古文字時，我們會遇到豙)。
examples.pinyin: Xué gǔ wénzì shí, wǒmen huì yùdào Yì.
examples.english: When studying ancient scripts, we may encounter 豙.
